meanings.definition: A fast and elusive running back in American football.
meanings.sent1: The scatback swiftly dodged the defenders on his way to the end zone.
meanings.sent2: The team's scatback is known for his speed and agility on the field.
meanings.sent3: The scatback's quick moves left the opposing team scratching their heads.
meanings.sent4: Like a scatback in a field of daisies, he weaved through the defense effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The scatback's lightning speed made him a formidable opponent.

meanings.definition: To run away quickly or hurriedly.
meanings.sent1: When the alarm sounded, the thief tried to scatback from the scene.
meanings.sent2: The cat will scatback if it hears a loud noise.
meanings.sent3: I had to scatback when I realized I was late for the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The squirrel decided to scatback when it saw the approaching dog.
meanings.sent5: She had to scatback to avoid getting caught in the rain.
